page.title: 04COMMUNICATIONS IN CLUNTON
page.content: The telephone system is maintained by British Telecom from a central installation at Aston-on-Clun. The exchange is "Little Brampton" the name taken from the hamlet at the crossroads of the Clun_Craven Arms_ Bishop's Castle roads known locally as the Top Road or the Bank. Wind, storms and lightning can put the lines out of action but they are soon repaired. Post is delivered by van once a day. The grapevine fills the vacuum left by all the offical systems. Messages, parcels and odds and ends are carried by local bus, milklady, postman, Meals on Wheels, and the Library van. The Parish magazine spreads the gospel ecclesiastical and secular. Coffee mornings, the bar of the Crown Inn at Clunton, and the notice board at Clunton also serve their part.
